example.context:
📝 For more detailed information about governance, please, check out governance page. 

To have a vote in the Lido DAO, and to contribute to the determination of any of the topics outlined above, one must hold the LDO governance token. Holding LDO gives DAO members a vote in the future of Lido, allowing each DAO member to have a personal say in the community. LDO voting weight is proportional to the amount of LDO a voter stakes in the voting contract. The more LDO in a user’s voting contract, the greater the decision-making power the voter gets. The exact mechanism of LDO voting can be upgraded just like the other DAO applications.

📝 If you have any initiatives you think will benefit the Lido protocol, share your thoughts in our governance forum.

Software​

The Lido DAO is an Aragon organization. Since Aragon provides a full end-to-end framework to build DAOs, we use its standard tools.

interactions.response: The Lido DAO is an Aragon organization that allows users to have a vote in the future of Lido, allowing each DAO member to have a personal say in the community.
LDO voting weight is proportional to the amount of LDO a voter stakes in the voting contract. The more LDO in a user’s voting contract, the greater the decision-making power the voter gets.

responses: The Lido DAO is a decentralized autonomous organization that provides collateralized loans. It uses an Ethereum-based protocol to facilitate these loans and is part of the larger Synthetix protocol. It enables users to access services like borrowing, lending, and staking. To learn more, please visit https://lido.fi/

The Lido DAO uses a system of voting to decide which loans are accepted, as well as how the interest rates and other parameters should be set. All voting is done on-chain and is open to anyone who is a Dai holder. You can learn more about the voting process at https://docs.lido.fi/governance/governance-overview/.
